summary: Adds a few books as a teaser for a larger mod I am working on. The aim of these books is to set the tone for the mod, and to provide some lore to perhaps provoke some interest.
descriptionHtml:
[size=5]Books of Treeton[/size]

[size=4]What is a Treeton and is this a Pokemon Mod?[/size]

Treeton is the name of a town mod I am working on, Treeton being the town. I have been working on the lore, story, characters and quests for a long time and finally decided to do something about it rather than continue writing fake history books in notepad. The town is a long way off, as I am still learning the ropes of Skyrim modding, going from something like Source into the Creation Kit hasn't been the smoothest transition but I'm determined to get this mod out there. 


[size=4]Okay that's great, so where is it and what will it be about?[/size]

Treeton is a small Breton settlement off the shores of Lake Ilinalta, underneath a gigantic tree which became the focal point of the settlement. The books go into greater detail of the Tree's history and the settlement (at the moment there are only two implemented but more will be coming while I fumble my way through the Creation Kit). The mod itself will revolve around two factions within the town and a conflict with the nearby Falkreath. At the moment it has 15 planned main characters, four planned endings and a lot of quests. 

[size=4]So what is this mod then? [/size]

This mod is pretty much a teaser, a quick little taste of what's to come. Hopefully, if I can get it together. When I need it, I may well enlist the help of any volunteers, voice actors and the like. If not then I'll take the more traditional approach of text walls, either way this remains as just a little taste, like if a chef came out and gave you a morsel of food and you were like "hey man, that's cool, where's the rest" and the chef is like "haven't made it yet, I mean I am planning on making it but I thought I'd do a little morsel to entice you" then you punch the chef in the face. There are two books in the mod so far but I am planning on adding more as I write and edit some more fake history books and even some stories/legends. But for now, I ask you to have faith, and not get outraged because a free mod only added two books to the game.

[size=4]HOLD THE DAMN PHONE! Where did you put the books?![/size]

[size=2]The books can be found in the Sleeping Giant Inn in Riverwood, they're sitting on the tables in the inn (kill me) and are available for light reading.[/size]
author: The Level 99 Woodcutter
